Text:
What Personal Information We Collect and Use:

“Personal Information” or “personal data” is any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person; an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.  Milestone generally purchases, licenses, collects, uses, and/or resells demographic data (name, address, and automobile information).  Milestone also occasionally purchases, licenses, collects, uses, and/or resells other categories of information (e.g., loan, household, or political and religious affiliation).  For additional details on what Personal Information we purchase, license, collect use, and resell, please consult the section below “Privacy Rights for California Residents.”

​
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Milestone purchases, licenses, collects, uses, retains, and processes – for as long as is reasonably necessary to satisfy the purpose of its collection – such information as is needed to (i) deliver the services ordered by Milestone’s customers; (ii) memorialize the contractual terms on which we supply services; (iii) process and invoice the services; (iv) respond to customer questions or requests; (v) provide access to certain areas and features of this website; (v) tailor content, publications, advertisements, and offers we believe may be of interest; (vi) test, research, analyze, and develop products; (vii) protect the rights, property, or safety of us, our clients, or others; and (viii) improve the website and Milestone’s systems.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Sold

Text:
Sharing of Personal Information

Milestone may share Personal Information with advertisers and other third-parties, including our customers and vendors.  The other parties with whom we share Personal Information may send information to you about their products or services.  These business partners are not authorized by us to use or disclose the information except as necessary to perform services on our behalf, as authorized under the terms of our agreements with them, or to comply with legal requirements.  They also agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Personal Information and to assure it is not unlawfully accessed and misused.

​

We may disclose information about you (i) if we are required to do so by law, court order or legal process; (ii) in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including to meet national security or law enforcement requirements; (iii) under the discovery process in litigation or arbitration; (iv) to enforce Milestone policies, contracts, or other rights; (v) to collect amounts owed to Milestone; (vi) when we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss or in connection with an investigation or prosecution of suspected or actual illegal activity; or (vii) if in good faith we believe that disclosure is otherwise necessary or advisable.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

Text: Milestone collects information through cookies and web beacons about your web browsing activities.  For example, we may use cookies to collect information about your website activity or to determine whether you are an existing or new visitor to our website.  Milestone may use the information collected from cookies and web beacons to optimize your experience on this website, to improve our services and products, for research and modeling, and for the management and security of this website.  Our website utilizes both temporary and persistent cookies to enhance your online experience.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text:
Changes to This Privacy Policy:

We may update or change this Privacy Policy from time to time and without prior notice to you.  We will post a “last modified” date for this Privacy Policy to indicate when it was most recently updated.  Any changes to this Privacy Policy will become effective when we post the revised Privacy Policy on this website.

​

Last Modified:

October 22, 2020
Label: Updated Privacy Policy

Text: Children’s Privacy on this Website \n\nThis website is not intended for use by children under the age of 18.  We do not knowingly collect, purchase, license, or sell the Personal Information from anyone under 18 years of age through this website.  If you are under 18, please do not submit any Personal Information on this website.
Label: Others

Text: To the extent Milestone “sells” your Personal Information, you also have the right to opt-out of that sale on a going-forward basis at any time.  If you do not want us to sell your Personal Information, please email us at privacy@milestonemarketingsolutions.com or select the “Do Not Sell My Information” link on our home page. After you opt out of the “sale” of your Personal Information, we will no longer “sell” your personal information to third-parties (except in an aggregated or de-identified manner so it is no longer personal information).

Text:
Sharing of Personal Information
\nMilestone may share Personal Information with advertisers and other third-parties, including our customers and vendors.  The other parties with whom we share Personal Information may send information to you about their products or services.  These business partners are not authorized by us to use or disclose the information except as necessary to perform services on our behalf, as authorized under the terms of our agreements with them, or to comply with legal requirements.  They also agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Personal Information and to assure it is not unlawfully accessed and misused.
\n​
\nWe may disclose information about you (i) if we are required to do so by law, court order or legal process; (ii) in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including to meet national security or law enforcement requirements; (iii) under the discovery process in litigation or arbitration; (iv) to enforce Milestone policies, contracts, or other rights; (v) to collect amounts owed to Milestone; (vi) when we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to prevent physical harm or financial loss or in connection with an investigation or prosecution of suspected or actual illegal activity; or (vii) if in good faith we believe that disclosure is otherwise necessary or advisable.  
\n​
\nIn addition, from time to time, server logs may be reviewed for security purposes – e.g., to detect unauthorized activity on this website.  In such cases, server log data containing IP addresses may be shared with law enforcement bodies in order that they may identify users in connection with their investigation of the unauthorized activities.
\n​

Milestone may share Personal Information with advertisers and other third-parties, including our customers and vendors.  The other parties with whom we share Personal Information may send information to you about their products or services.  These business partners are not authorized by us to use or disclose the information except as necessary to perform services on our behalf, as authorized under the terms of our agreements with them, or to comply with legal requirements.  They also agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Personal Information and to assure it is not unlawfully accessed and misused.

Text:
Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies:

When you visit this website, we collect certain information by automated means to help us improve our website and provide customized services and information.  Like many companies, we collect this information through the use of cookies, web beacons, and other tracking technologies.  Cookies and web beacons are small text files that are downloaded and stored to your computer’s memory and hard drive when you visit certain websites.  Some cookies are automatically deleted when you close your browser or after a short period (temporary cookies), while others can be stored longer on your computer, sometimes until you delete them manually (persistent cookies).  

​

Milestone collects information through cookies and web beacons about your web browsing activities.  For example, we may use cookies to collect information about your website activity or to determine whether you are an existing or new visitor to our website.  Milestone may use the information collected from cookies and web beacons to optimize your experience on this website, to improve our services and products, for research and modeling, and for the management and security of this website.  Our website utilizes both temporary and persistent cookies to enhance your online experience.

​
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: If you wish to restrict, block, or delete the cookies that are set by our website, you can do so using your browser settings.  Most browsers allow you to control cookies, including whether to accept them and how to disable existing cookies. You may also set most browsers to notify you if you receive a new cookie.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
For more information about cookies and how to remove them on your browser, you can visit www.allaboutcookies.org or these third-party websites:

Google Chrome

Internet Explorer

Mozilla Firefox

Safari Desktop

Safari Mobile

Android

Opera
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Other tracking technologies may record information.  For example, collecting IP addresses is standard practice on the Internet and is done automatically by many websites.  Our website does not respond to “do not track” signals.  It is not our practice to link the information we record using cookies or other tracking technologies to any Personal Information you submit through the website.  However, we reserve the right to use cookies and other tracking technologies to identify a visitor. We may do so, for example, when we believe it is necessary to protect this website, our visitors, licensees, or other third parties, or to protect our rights or defend against a claim relating to us, or when we believe that the law requires it.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: Personal Information does not include: publicly available information from government records; de-identified or aggregated consumer information; or information excluded from the CCPA’s scope such as health or medical information covered by the Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) or personal information covered by certain sector-specific privacy laws, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA).  Our uses and sharing of Personal Information are described herein.
Label: Categories of Personal Information Collected

Text: California residents have the right to request that we disclose certain information about our collection and use of your Personal Information over the past 12 months.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: If you are a California resident and would like to request additional information about the types of personal data Milestone has collected, purchased, licensed, shared, or resold with third parties, you may email us at privacy@MilestoneMarketingSolutions.com or contact us through one of the additional channels listed below.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: California residents have the right to request that we disclose certain information about our collection and use of your Personal Information over the past 12 months.
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: California residents also have the right to request that we delete any of your Personal Information, subject to certain exceptions.
Label: Description of Right to Delete

Text: To the extent Milestone “sells” your Personal Information, you also have the right to opt-out of that sale on a going-forward basis at any time.
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: If you do not want us to sell your Personal Information, please email us at privacy@milestonemarketingsolutions.com or select the “Do Not Sell My Information” link on our home page.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: After you opt out of the “sale” of your Personal Information, we will no longer “sell” your personal information to third-parties (except in an aggregated or de-identified manner so it is no longer personal information).
Label: Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

Text: Only you or a person registered with the California Secretary of State that you authorize to act on your behalf, may make a verifiable consumer request related to your Personal Information.
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text: Once we receive and confirm your verifiable consumer request, we may disclose to you:\n\nCategories of Personal Information we collected about you;
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: Our business or commercial purpose for collecting that Personal Information;
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text: The categories of third-parties with whom we share that Personal Information; and
Label: Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared

Text: The specific pieces of Personal Information we collected about you (also called a data portability request).
Label: Description of Right to Know PI Collected

Text:
If you have any questions or comments about this Privacy Policy, the ways in which we collect and use your Personal Information, your choices and rights regarding such use, or wish to exercise your rights under California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) (available to California residents only), please do not hesitate to contact us at:

Phone: 1-800-313-1873
Website: www.milestonemarketingsolutions.com
Email: privacy@milestonemarketingsolutions.com
Postal Address: Milestone Marketing Solutions
Att: Dustin Struckman, Chief Data Officer
844 Waterbury Falls Drive, Suite 201
O’Fallon, MO 63368
Label: Methods to exercise rights

Text:
Changes to This Privacy Policy:

We may update or change this Privacy Policy from time to time and without prior notice to you.  We will post a “last modified” date for this Privacy Policy to indicate when it was most recently updated.  Any changes to this Privacy Policy will become effective when we post the revised Privacy Policy on this website.

Label: Updated Privacy Policy
